title: Inner wedding veil (Patori)
text: Muslim brides in the Banni district of  Kutch wore layers of veils.  Hidden from view, like the bride herself, was a red and green, lotus-patterned cloth called <I>patori<I>.  The finest <I>patoris<I> were done in tie-dye, for which Kutch was famous. Printed versions mimicking tie-dye were also popular.
description: resist tie-dyed; rust red, green and white; four medallions (large) inside green squares; vertical center join
creditline: Gift of Richard L. Simmons and Rosa Lynn Pinkus
